response.summary: Engineer passionate about water treatment (drinking, waste water and food & beverages industry). With experiences in Research & Development, pilots and plants
response.skills: prosim, Microsoft Office, Matlab, humberto, Visual Basic

profile_positions.description:
Technical support to the more than 180 plants of the group on water treatment related topics (Quality, Food safety, Utilities, Performance and Production volumes). Troubleshooting, commissioning, consolidate Know-how, trainings, new technologies implementation, specification writing

Accompaniment of projects to reduce water consumption in plants (Reduce, Recycle, Reuse and Reclaim). 

Technologies: Ultrafiltration (UF), Reverse Osmosis (RO), Microfiltration (MF), Nanofiltration (NF), MBR, Ion exchange, Ozonation, Chlorination, Sand filter, UV, Selective sands, nature-based solutions
profile_positions.title: Water Processing Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Biofiltration: Biological removal of ammonium / nitrite and manganese.
- Responsible for the pilot installation: Media Filters, Reverse Osmosis, UV, etc.
- Simulation: mineral composition and taste of water.
- Physico-chemistry of sparkling waters.
- Calco-carbonic equilibrium. Corrosion and scaling issues
profile_positions.title: Water Sciences & Technology Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Writing of Danone standards for water treatment units: reverse osmosis, ultrafiltration, UV reactor, remineralisation, Food Safety solutions.
- Technical support at world-level factories: Equipment design, troubleshooting, implementation, tender phase, supplier relations and training for local teams.
- Co-animation of the internal community of water experts: R&I, Hydrogeology, Processing, Food Safety, Quality and Regulatory Managers.
profile_positions.title: Water Process Engineer - Central Processing Team

profile_positions.description:
- Follow-up of a biofiltration pilot for groundwater treatment, collection and treatment of physicochemical data and realization of maintenance activities.
- Laboratory analyses for the characterization of the nitrifying and oxidizing manganese biological activity in groundwater.
- Bibliographic study and knowledge sharing between the industry and the academy.
- Project management: Budget, data and results, planning.
profile_positions.title: Trainee - Water Sciences & Technology

profile_positions.description:
- Technical and economic study of a modification to handle the waste and the pathogenic effluents coming from the filtration of surface water.
- Implementation of an IT tool to fulfill the regulatory requirements related to the treatment of disinfection of raw water to tackle pathogenic risk.
profile_positions.title: Intership - Environmental Engineer

school.name: Institut national des Sciences appliquées de Toulouse

education.degree_name: Process and Environmental Engineering - Water Treatment

company.name: Danone
company.description:
Danone is a leading multi-local food and beverage company building on health-focused and fast-growing categories in 3 businesses: Essential Dairy & Plant-Based products, Waters and Specialized Nutrition. With its ‘One Planet. One Health’ frame of action, which considers the health of people and the planet as intimately interconnected, Danone aims to inspire healthier and more sustainable eating and drinking practices. To accelerate this food revolution and create superior, sustainable, profitable value for all its stakeholders, Danone has defined nine 2030 Goals, and paved the way as the first listed company to adopt the “Entreprise à Mission” status in France. 

With a purpose to bring health through food to as many people as possible, and corresponding social, societal and environmental objectives set out in its articles of association, Danone commits to operating in an efficient, responsible and inclusive manner, in line with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the United Nations. By 2025, Danone aims to become one of the first multinational companies to obtain B CorpTM certification. 

With more than 100,000 employees, and products sold in over 120 markets, Danone generated €25.3 billion in sales in 2019. Danone’s portfolio includes leading international brands (Actimel, Activia, Alpro, Aptamil, Danette, Danio, Danonino, evian, Nutricia, Nutrilon, Volvic, among others) as well as strong local and regional brands (including AQUA, Blédina, Bonafont, Cow & Gate, Horizon Organic, Mizone, Oikos, Prostokvashino, Silk, Vega). Listed on Euronext Paris and present on the OTCQX market via an ADR (American Depositary Receipt) program, Danone is a component stock of leading sustainability indexes including the ones managed by Vigeo Eiris and Sustainalytics, as well as the Ethibel Sustainability Index, the MSCI ESG Indexes, the FTSE4Good Index Series, Bloomberg Gender Equality Index, and the Access to Nutrition Index.
